hero.title: Understanding Blockchain Anchoring & Data Validation
hero.subtitle: Learn how vehicle data is cryptographically secured and how you can verify its authenticity.

whatIs.title: What is Blockchain Anchoring?
whatIs.description: Anchoring is the process of cryptographically binding vehicle history data to a blockchain - Algorand. Instead of storing entire documents on-chain (which would be public and compromise privacy), we store a compact cryptographic fingerprint called a CID (Content Identifier). This CID is derived from the data itself, meaning any change to the original data would produce a different CID. This creates an immutable, tamper-proof record that proves the data existed in its current form at a specific point in time—while keeping the actual sensitive data private and under your control.

steps.title: Access Event History in Your Vehicle Record
steps.description: View any event in your vehicle's history. You'll see the CBOR data, CID, and Transaction ID (txnId) all visible and ready for verification.
details: Each anchored event displays its CBOR representation (compact binary data)
The CID is displayed as a unique content identifier
The txnId links to the specific Algorand blockchain transaction

steps.title: Verify Data Integrity Using CBOR Decoder
steps.description: Take the CBOR data and decode it using an external tool like https://cbor.williamchong.cloud to verify it matches the original event data.
details: CBOR decoders are freely available online and in open-source libraries
Decoding the CBOR should produce the exact JSON event data you see in the history
This confirms the binary representation is correct and uncorrupted

steps.title: Hash the CBOR Data
steps.description: Take the CBOR binary data and compute its SHA-256 hash. You can do this using any standard cryptographic tool or online SHA-256 calculator.
details: Hash the exact CBOR bytes that were anchored
This hash should match the digest contained in the CID

steps.title: Inspect the CID
steps.description: Visit https://cid.ipfs.tech and paste your CID to inspect its structure and extract the hash digest.
details: CID Inspector reveals the hash algorithm used (typically SHA-256)
The hash digest from the CID should match the hash you calculated from CBOR
This proves the data hasn't been modified since anchoring

steps.title: Verify on Algorand Blockchain
steps.description: Use the txnId to inspect the actual Algorand blockchain transaction. The transaction's note field should contain the CID.
details: Visit an Algorand explorer and look up the transaction by ID
The CID in the blockchain note proves this specific data was anchored at that block height
The blockchain timestamp provides immutable proof of when the data was recorded

items.name: Content Identifier (CID)
items.explanation: A unique, encoded identifier derived from data content. Same data always produces the same CID. It's self-describing and includes version and hash algorithm information.

items.name: CBOR Encoding
items.explanation: Concise Binary Object Representation. A compact binary format that ensures deterministic serialization—the same data always encodes to identical bytes, making it perfect for cryptographic verification.

items.name: Cryptographic Hash
items.explanation: A one-way mathematical function (SHA-256) that converts any amount of data into a fixed-size fingerprint. Impossible to reverse, and any data change produces a different hash.

items.name: Data Integrity
items.explanation: Proof that data hasn't been modified. By comparing your generated hash with the CID digest, you verify the data is exactly as it was when originally anchored.

items.name: Immutable Record
items.explanation: Once a CID is written to the blockchain, it cannot be changed. The blockchain timestamp proves when the data existed, creating a permanent, chronological record.

items.name: Decentralized Trust
items.explanation: Validation requires no central authority. Authorized parties with access to the data can independently verify it against the blockchain record, making trust cryptographic rather than institutional.

step1.title: Step 1: Get Your CID from the Blockchain
step1.description: When a vehicle event is anchored, its CID is stored on the Algorand blockchain. You can retrieve it from the event details in your vehicle history.

step2.title: Step 2: Retrieve the Original Data
step2.description: Export or fetch the actual vehicle event data. This is typically the JSON representation of the event that was anchored.
step2.code:
{
  "event": "inspection",
  "date": "2024-01-15",
  "mileage": 45000,
  "notes": "Full inspection completed. All systems functional.",
  "inspector": "John Smith"
}

step3.title: Step 3: Encode to CBOR and Hash
step3.description: Convert the JSON data to CBOR binary format, then compute the SHA-256 hash of that binary data.
step3.code:
1. CBOR encode the data (binary representation)
2. Calculate SHA-256 hash of CBOR bytes
3. Get hash digest: a1c2e3f4b5d6c7e8f9a0b1c2d3e4f5a6
           (64 character hex string)

step4.title: Step 4: Verify the Hash
step4.description: Decode the CID to extract its hash digest, then compare with your calculated hash. They should match exactly.
step4.code:
CID hash digest:  a1c2e3f4b5d6c7e8f9a0b1c2d3e4f5a6
Calculated hash:  a1c2e3f4b5d6c7e8f9a0b1c2d3e4f5a6
                 ✓ MATCH - Data is authentic!

result.title: Validation Successful
result.description: The matching hashes prove that the data you have is exactly what was anchored on the blockchain. No modifications, no tampering. Your vehicle's record is verified as authentic and immutable.

why.title: Why This Matters for Your Vehicle Records

benefits.title: Cryptographic Proof of Authenticity
benefits.description: Validation proves your vehicle's history hasn't been modified. A matching hash is mathematical proof of data integrity.

benefits.title: Tamper Detection
benefits.description: Any modification to the data, no matter how small, produces a different hash. This makes tampering immediately detectable.

benefits.title: Decentralized Verification
benefits.description: You don't need to trust Classics Chain or any intermediary. You can verify the data yourself using open-source tools and cryptographic standards.

benefits.title: Permanent Record
benefits.description: The blockchain timestamp proves your vehicle's history existed at a specific moment. It's permanently recorded and publicly verifiable.

benefits.title: Resale Confidence
benefits.description: Buyers can independently verify your vehicle's documented history, increasing trust and value. The record is as old as the blockchain proves it to be.

benefits.title: Industry Standard
benefits.description: CID, CBOR, and SHA-256 are widely adopted open standards. This isn't proprietary—it's technology anyone in the world can verify with common tools.
